page.title: 07RELIGION WEST OF KEMPSFORD
page.content: {Kempsford}church is at the east end outside this survey. {Castle Eaton}and {Marston Meysey,}both{Wiltshire} villages, are in the Deanery of {Fairford}and the Diocese of{ {Gloucester.}Their churches (St.Mary the Virgin and St James) have been combined with{Meysey Hampton}under the latter's incumbent who conducts a service at each church each Sunday. There is no chapel and Non-Conformists travel outside the area. The churches with electoral rolls of 30 and 25 respectively are well cared for and the graveyards neatly maintained. St Mary's has volunteer rotas for mowing the surrounds, cleaning the church and providing flowers. There are two churchwardens, a Parochial Church Council of 11, a choir, bellringers and a small Sunday School.
